snippet: Opposition activists said as many as 78 civilians were killed by pro-government militiamen and security forces, as dozens of other countries sought to isolate President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Syrian opposition activists report a mass killing of villagers by pro-government militiamen and security forces; if verified, it will be the fourth massacre in less than two weeks and will likely inject a new surge of angry momentum into the growing international effort to isolate President Bashar al-Assad and remove him from power.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ANNIE LOWREY
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Annie Lowrey from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Alan Cowell from London; Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul; and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: Opposition activists said as many as 78 civilians were killed by pro-government militiamen and security forces, as dozens of other countries sought to isolate President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: U.S. and Dozens of Other Countries Issue New Warning to Syria
headline.main: Amid Reports of New Massacre, Nations Press Syria
headline.print_headline: Amid Reports of a New Massacre, Nations Seek to Step Up Pressure on Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
